CatDescriptText: Paul Hein, bartender, Fisher Street and Esther Brown, co-owner of beauty shoppe, Fifth Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that labor unions, in general, are doing all they can to see that Negroes are not discriminated against in hiring and upgrading in employment?"  Mr. Hein's answer reads: I think so."  Mrs. Brown's answer reads: "I think they are now, more than ever.  They are making good progress."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Paul Hein wearing dark flecked overcoat and plaid shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Esther Brown wearing light colored cap and light colored coat with upturned collar, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
